TopicTitle: The "You know you're playing a lot of KSP when..." thread

Articles.Content: You know you play to much KSP when you want to fast forward Youtubevideos with . and ,
when its the only thing you think of!
When you stop outside a shady liquor store to take a pic in -20*C weather Because you just figured out the Kerbal universe...it's an angry drunk.
LOL Kracken Rum. No wonder Bob Kerman is always happy.
When you complain that your class isn't being taught orbital mechanics in Physics.
When you find the speedometer in your car frightening because you think in meters per second.

I haven't seen one of these threads yet, forgive me if it exists already.

I fell asleep last night watching some 1990's videos from NASA on orbital mechanics. I then woke up this morning, made a coffee, fed the cats and started watching this Orbital Mechanics video from MIT and realised, that I spend way too much time obsessing over KSP.

http://youtu.be/8EWohKdE6oA

Thank you Squad, for enhancing my life; really.

Does anyone else here have an unusual affinity with KSP that has changed their daily routine in some small way, or is it just me?

I got a bad grade on a math test, and I tried to revert flight...
When used cardboard shipping tubes at work ( 3 to 10 inches in dia a foot or so long ) start to look like fuel tanks and SRBs and what is worse you ask to take them home to "play with "

Good to see this is still going Phenom Anon X, and I hope it keeps going for some time yet, stickied

Plus, you know you play KSP too much when you start smiling like Jebediah!

Good to see this is still going Phenom Anon X, and I hope it keeps going for some time yet, stickied

Plus, you know you play KSP too much when you start smiling like Jebediah!

I smile like Jebediah whenever I get an encounter with another planet...
You know you play too much ksp when you make a roleplaying site using weebly.
You know you play too much ksp when you hear birds outside and think you are on the Space Center screen

You know you play too much ksp when you hear birds outside and think you are on the Space Center screen

You know you play too much KSP when you think birds are just a sound and don't connect them to any physical entity.

When you spend the entirety of 'Gravity' naming ISS modules and pointing out physics errors.

I refused to see that movie because the Space Shuttle/s are retired in real life. 2> Sandra Bullock would be wearing nappies on ISS = not sexy

3> How much fuel would they use going from Hubble to ISS again ??? FAIL

Edited March 2, 2014 by Lohan2008

3> How much fuel would they use going from Hubble to ISS again ??? FAIL

I think it was Jeb's jetpack... Or Jebpack? Nothing else has so much delta v.

I refused to see that movie because the Space Shuttle/s are retired in real life. 2> Sandra Bullock would be wearing nappies on ISS = not sexy

3> How much fuel would they use going from Hubble to ISS again ??? FAIL

Never mind that Debris completely switches direction MID-ORBIT!

When you complain that your class isn't being taught orbital mechanics in Physics.

THIS. All we got was planetary motion, AND it was lumped in with the rest of the rotational motion stuff, instead of its own chapter.
When you start wondering what would happen if someone made a DF/KSP crossover game

When you start wondering what would happen if someone made a DF/KSP crossover game

I think you may have just broken my brain. Cannot comprehend awesome of this idea.

You know you play KSP too much when;

You attempt to break speed records to kill a little time before going to school. This does include creating said craft.

...When you notice that the loading screen planets are screwed up. the outside planet orbits faster than the middle planet...

...when you save a little money every once in a while to buy 3 2 liters of mountain dew and 6 bags of hostess chocolate covered mini donuts to try and break your KSP continious play record. mine happens to be 73 1/2 hours straight at the moment.... ....

...when you get into an accident with someone, and after you get out of the car, the first thing you say to the other person is "sorry man, i would reload but i forgot to quicksave."...

...when you save a little money every once in a while to buy 3 2 liters of mountain dew and 6 bags of hostess chocolate covered mini donuts to try and break your KSP continious play record. mine happens to be 73 1/2 hours straight at the moment.... ....

When you stock up on Solid Chocolate Boosters and Liquid Lemonade Fuel for your KSP session...

...When you notice that the loading screen planets are screwed up. the outside planet orbits faster than the middle planet...

This has bothered me for a while. Guess I play too much.
When you curse Rosetta for taking forever to get to 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko.

When you use the term space station to describe a promiscuous person.

Edited March 5, 2014 by Felsmak
